ojc.ahni.hyperneat

Class HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.ahni.hyperneat.HyperNEATFitnessFunction
      • ojc.ahni.hyperneat.HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, java.io.Serializable, BulkFitnessFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestTargetFitnessFunction

    public class HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction
extends HyperNEATFitnessFunction
    Given a set of genotypes that encode a neural network, and a set of training examples consisting of input and target (desired) output pattern pairs, determines fitness based on how close the output of the network encoded by each genome is to the target output given some input.
    Author:
    Oliver Coleman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • ERROR_TYPE_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String ERROR_TYPE_KEY
        The type of error calculation to perform for each input and target output pair. Valid types are:
        • sum: the sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
        • sum-squared: the sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
        • squared-sum: the squared sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
        • squared-sum-squared: the squared sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • inputPatterns

        protected double[][][] inputPatterns
        Array containing stimuli (input) examples, in the form [trial][y][x]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.

      • targetOutputPatterns

        protected double[][][] targetOutputPatterns
        Array containing target (desired output) examples, in the form [trial][y][x]. The dimensions should match those of the output layer of the substrate network.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction

        protected HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction()

      • HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction

        public HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction(double[][][] inputPatterns,
                              double[][][] targetOutputPatterns,
                              double minTargetValue,
                              double maxTargetValue)
        Create a HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction with the specified input and output examples.
        Parameters:
        inputPatterns - Array containing input patterns, in the form [trial][y][x]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.
        targetOutputPatterns - Array containing target output patterns, in the form [trial][y][x]. The dimensions should match those of the output layer of the substrate network.
        minTargetValue - The minimum possible value in the given input patterns.
        maxTargetValue - The maximum possible value in the given target patterns.

      • setMaxFitnessValue

        protected void setMaxFitnessValue(int newMaxFitnessValue)
        Sets the maximum possible fitness value this function will return. Default is 1000000 which is fine for nearly all purposes.
        Parameters:
        newMaxFitnessValue - The new maximum fitness.

      • setTargetRange

        protected void setTargetRange(double min,
                  double max)
        Sets the minimum and maximum values in the target examples.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum possible target value.
        max - The maximum possible target value.

      • evaluate

        protected int evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
           Activator substrate,
           int evalThreadIndex)
        Description copied from class: HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Evaluate an individual genotype. This method is called from HyperNEATFitnessFunction.evaluate(List) , and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.

      • scale

        protected void scale(int scaleCount,
         int scaleFactor)
        Description copied from class: HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Allow sub-class to make the necessary changes when a substrate scale occurs. If implemented, then at a minimum this method will usually need to set new values for the HyperNEATFitnessFunction.width and {#link height} array fields, and the HyperNEATFitnessFunction.connectionRange field if applicable.
        Overrides:
        scale in class HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        scaleCount - A count of how many times a scale has previously occurred. In the first call this has value 0.
        scaleFactor - The amount the substrate is being scaled by.
